definition: to overdose on supplementary medicine/to cram too hard
to repair/to patch/to mend/to make up for/to fill (a vacancy)/to supplement

sentences.english: Night-before cramming requires playing the odds, and your best bet is on the big stuff.
sentences.chinese: 夜前惡補要有勝算，你最好的賭注應該放在重點上。

sentences.english: Don't cram the night before the exam.
sentences.chinese: 不要在考試前夜填鴨式惡補。

sentences.english: First of all, I rent a suit, and then I work hard at perfecting my eating manners.
sentences.chinese: 首先，我租了一套西服，然後惡補了一下就餐禮儀。

sentences.english: How bone up can be effective in the condition of the limited time and energy.
sentences.chinese: 但時間有限，精力有限，怎麼惡補才見效呢？

sentences.english: I decided to fix my Yoga Deficit Disorder.
sentences.chinese: 於是我決定惡補我的瑜伽知識。

sentences.english: The method of breaking through the bottleneck is to bone up on typical materials.
sentences.chinese: 突破這個瓶頸的辦法是惡補典型材料。

sentences.english: In fact, the holiday " cramming Wind" a few years ago began to prevail.
sentences.chinese: 其實，假期“惡補風”幾年前就開始盛行。

sentences.english: They feel that many undergraduates now urgently need remedial help with study skills.
sentences.chinese: 他們認爲許多本科生都需要惡補學習技能這一課。

sentences.english: The summertime may be the only time you can squeeze in some courses.
sentences.chinese: 這個夏天可能是您唯一能夠惡補這些課程的時候了。

sentences.english: You will also need to bone up on Vitamin C while you're doing the most work.
sentences.chinese: 在你開始工作以前，最好惡補下關於維生素C的知識。

sentences.english: So, he spent 30 minutes every evening catching up at home.
sentences.chinese: 因而，他每天晚上在家花30分鐘惡補這方面的消息。

sentences.english: My boss asked me to take a test, so I'm just boning up on some things I need to know.
sentences.chinese: 我老闆叫我考一個試，所以我正在惡補一些必要知識。

definition: lit. to clasp the Buddha's feet when danger arises (idiom); fig. to profess devotion only when in trouble/doing things at the last minute/making a hasty last-minute effort
to murmur endearments (idiom)/to get into a romantic relationship
hard to explain in a few words (idiom); complicated and not easy to express succinctly
to be a real headache/to find sth a real headache/to beat one's brains
to worry/to fret/to be anxious/to become sad
hard to say/unpleasant to say/can't be sure
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
